conversations.content: Please note that this story contains spoilers for Chapter 14 of the main campaign.
Once every 99 years, the Rite of the Lambentree is conducted.
It is a sacred ritual of the Ilian Church where the Auspex offers her holy mana to the earth and sky.
*sigh* Can nothing be done?
Something on your mind, Elly? That's quite the grimace you're rocking.
Hello, Notte. No, I was merely thinking...
If that's thinking, I'd hate to see fretting. C'mon, spill the beans to ol' Notte.
It regards the Rite of the Lambentree.
The what now?
It is a ritual of the Church performed every 99 years. In it, the Auspex offers her mana to a tree known as the Lambentree.
Said mana passes up through the tree and into the heavens, returning to earth as holy rain said to bring prosperity to mankind.
Yeaaah, that sorta rings a bell. But wait, isn't the current Auspex...?
Princess Zethia, yes.
'Zactly. And since she's, uh, indisposed, I guess you've gotta cancel it.
No wonder you're bumming. Still, I'll bet this isn't the first time this event hasn't panned out like everyone wanted.
Indeed, in times when no one possessing of the holy mana emerged to become Auspex, the rite was not held.
But in each case, an epoch-defining calamity befell the land soon after.
Dude, this Lambentree has ZERO chill...
Yeah, this is a real dill of a pickle all right. Hmmmmmm...
A-HA! GOT IT!
Er, you ＂got＂ what?
I know who can take Zethia's place!
Wait. Could you mean...?
...And so you wish me to perform this rite in the stead of your Zethia?
We do. Will you grant us this boon?
I am willing to help, but...
C'mon, Zena! At least give it a shot! You're seriously our only hope here.
Very well. I shall do what I can.
Yaaaay!
On one condition.
And what is that?
...So your condition is that I assist in your training? I certainly don't mind, but what manner of training do you require?
Two powers inhabit my body; I wish to cultivate complete control over them.
One is your Auspex power, yeah? So what's the other one?
Pray do not say a trace of the Other's power yet remains within you!
Alas, I had thought I'd completely expelled it back then, but...
Aaah ha ha! What do you think you can do, broken and powerless as you are?
I have lost...everything...
But I have power enough left to send them far from here!
And please...live.
You're talking about the fight at the Binding Ruins, right? When you saved us?
I am. In that struggle, I exhausted my mana and had to retreat, severing my path to this world in the process.
You know, I always forget that you're just a spiritual mana projection thingie.
Your body yet remains in your own world, clutching the Dawnshard in slumber.
The Dawnshard is incredible, but so, too, is the Auspex's power. To be able to exist beyond your own world is truly miraculous.
I suppose it is. But as I am now, I both am the Auspex and am not.
There is only one way to perform the rite with two conflicting powers within me:
I must learn to suppress the Other's power entirely while releasing my mana in full.
So you have to maintain absolute control over two totally opposite energies at the same time? Yikes, dude. YIKES.
Is turning one off completely while the other's going full blast even possible?
I shall have to attempt it and see. I will suppress the Other now...
And begin releasing my mana...
So this is the mana of the Auspex...
Ooo, it's all sparkly and warm! It's totally different from normal magic!
More... Mooore!
Um, Zena?
*gasp* *heave* NNNNGH!
Zena!
Are you all right?!
I am sorry. The process was going well at first, but then...
Holy twerks, that was amazing—you even got a new outfit! ...Actually, hang on. WHY did you get a new outfit, exactly?
My body and clothing both are comprised entirely of mana.
I was intentionally suppressing the Other's power and releasing holy mana, so that must have affected my outfit.
Spiritual mana projections are a curious thing indeed.
What do you think, Zena? Will you be able to conduct the rite?
It will require some time, but I shall do my best.
And the strain isn't too great?
No. This time, I swear...
This time?
Er, it is nothing. Now if you will excuse me, I am drained and need to rest.
She seemed a little hesitant when we first asked her, but got pretty fired up by the end there!
Mmm. Indeed...
But do you think she'll be all right? It seemed pretty rough on her.
We can do naught but trust in her; Zena is the only one who can spare this world from utter calamity.
(I must succeed—for my own salvation as much as theirs.)
Congratulations, Zethia!
Thank you, Brother. That's very kind.
Once today's rite of presentation is done, you'll be the Auspex for real—and that's when things get REALLY busy.
From the moment I was born as one with holy mana, I have been waiting for this day.
Now I can finally be of use to everyone, and will do so to the best of my ability.
Well, there's a whole crowd packed into the city square to catch a glimpse of you.
You've got this, Zethia. Go on.
Right.
(As the Auspex, I seek to protect this world through the power of prayer.)
(This is Notte's world. Euden's world.)
...I won't forget the simple wish I held in those days.
I had a place in the world. I had people I loved who also loved me in turn. I had a world I wanted to protect.
I had a reason to exist. Permission to be. But what have I now? Nothing.
(I have no right to exist in this world, foreign to it as I am.)
I am not Zethia.
(At least, not the Zethia you all cherish.)
(The reason you all treat me with such kindness is that you see her in me.)
(But none in this world have any cause to hold dear an interloper like me.)
(I must do all I can to be of use; to make a difference, however small, so that I might earn a true place here.)
...I must perform this rite correctly.
It is the Auspex's calling, even if I am unable to undertake it with the same pure and simple heart I held back then.
I cannot be that person, but please do not hate me for it, Euden.
Ngh... No! Deeper still!
*huff* *pant* N-not yet. It is not enough!
...Blast. Another failure.
(No matter how many times I try, the Other's power within me stifles the flow of the Auspex's mana.)
Is there no way...?
Are you all right, Zena?
Ah! Hello to you both.
Elly told me about your training. It's admirable, but are you sure you aren't pushing yourself too hard?
I've no other choice.
You look as though a stiff breeze might topple you. If you keep this up, you'll run out of mana again and...
I tell you, I've no other choice.
What's driving you here? Why are you so adamant to see this thing through?
Because I am not your Zethia!
What do you mean by—
Apologies. I must go and cool my head.
She seems rather desperate.
Yeah. She does.
We can't leave things like this. I'll go talk to her.
She's crossed countless worlds and experienced grief almost beyond measure. I know she has plenty on her mind.
I'll never know what it's like to be her, but I know we'll come to an understanding if we just try.
*sigh*
Beep beep beep! Zena alert!
There you are. Can we talk?
This is about earlier, I assume?
Yes. What did you mean? What does ＂not being your Zethia＂ have to do with you pushing yourself so hard?
Talk to me. Please.
...I am pushing myself so I might earn permission to exist here.
For if I bring no benefit to all of you, what purpose do I even serve?
I am a stranger to this world. That is all, and nothing else.
So you want to perform this rite to raise our opinion of you?
And you think that will serve as permission for you to continue existing here?
Yes. For an outsider such as myself, it is the only way to carve out a place and forge a life with worth and meaning.
Throughout the countless worlds I traveled, it has always been thus.
But that's not how belonging works— OR how we measure a person's worth.
You've suffered so much already.
You've lost allies, been betrayed, and probably faced a litany of other horrors I don't even know about.
I know it's hard to trust people, but I want you to know this:
We all consider you our dear friend.
And can you be certain you treasure me for me, and not because I am, in a sense, the Zethia you love above all others?
I can. You are you and no one else— and that's all I see when I look at you.
You're right, you know? You're NOT our Zethia.
You're Zena. Zethia's someone else. We're all smart enough to get that.
And knowing this, you would still name me a friend? You've always seen me that way?
That's right.
I seem to have misunderstood you all. I was off on my own, spinning in circles.
Well, lemme make it super clear: We love the SNOT out of you!
Yet I cannot forgive myself, let alone love myself. You would say such even still?
Without hesitation. And if you can't love yourself, we'll just have to love you even more to make up the difference.
What one lacks, another can make up for. That's what it means to be with someone.
Now come on—it's late and getting cold. We should get back to the castle.
(I won't be able to change overnight. I cannot love myself, and struggle to trust others.)
(But I WANT to change; I WANT to be different for all of them. So I...)
Euden!
Hmm? What's up?
There is something I have been keeping from you all.
And once you hear it, you may not wish to name me a friend so freely.
But if I am to be worthy of the trust you placed in me and change myself...
I must tell you my secret.
I've gathered everyone like you asked, Zena. Go ahead.
I have kept something from you all in regard to the Lambentree ritual.
I have already performed the rite back in my own world.
And what came of it?
I failed. The Other's fell power tainted the Lambentree, and the result was...horrific.
I cannot say what might happen here should I attempt the rite again.
Which is why you have been training with such vigor, I assume.
Yes. But I felt that if I told you about this, you wouldn't trust me to perform the rite.
Which would remove my only opportunity to earn a true place among you.
This was selfish of me, and I apologize. I understand now that I should have told you the complete truth straightaway.
Well, thank you for doing so now, Zena. ...Elly? What do you think.
I understand her concerns, but there's no telling what ill might come of NOT doing the rite, either.
And while there are records of the rite not being performed in the Auspex's absence, it has never been skipped while one exists.
If we fail to perform it now, I fear Zethia will go down in history as the first of her station to so neglect her duties.
She wanted to serve as the Auspex above all other things. To fail like that...
Considering all of those factors, I believe the conclusion is clear: We will continue entrusting the task to Zena.
You are certain?
You just need to get control over the Other's power, yeah?
You will have the entire Halidom's support in this. I shall begin by gathering those skilled in the manipulation of mana.
Zena, if you prove unable to control the Other's power by the day of the rite, I'm afraid we'll have to cancel it...
I understand—and I won't let you down.
You're the only one who can save this world, Zena.
And I shall. I swear to you all, I will perfect my control over the Other's power in time for the Lambentree rite!
This should be...
Ngh... AAAAAAAH!
Another failure...
Perhaps if you unleashed your mana in stages?
When released all at once, the resistance from the Other's power is too great.
Yes, I see. I will give it a try!
Seems like Zena's out of her funk.
And she's hanging out with people again, which is great to see.
Woooo!
Phew...
Nice hustle out there, Zena! How you feeling?
I've received advice from so many people lately and feel close to a breakthrough.
I'm glad to hear it.
That would never have been the case were it not for you two.
Aw, shucks! We didn't do nothin'.
But you did, at least to me— it was extremely special.
I had given up; abandoned any hope of being dear to another, independent of my usefulness to them.
I've been called a traitor in some worlds, a murderer in others. And somewhere along the way, I came to believe it.
Okay, these other-world people sound like huge jerkfaces! You were taken over by an ancient DEMON for the love'a cake!
And it performed atrocities using this body; I can't blame them for feeling as they did.
At first, I suffered. Then came despair, and after that, a grim acceptance that I would ever be the villain in any world unfortunate enough to host me.
I thought the only reason you all treated me with such kindness was because you saw me as Zethia's replacement.
Which is why I felt the only way to hold onto my place here was to make myself a useful pawn in whatever scheme you required of me.
Looking back on it now, I am ashamed. Forgive me for assuming the worst of you.
Forgiven! And seriously, I like this new, chipper you a LOT more than the glum chum you were earlier. I think dropping that whole ＂I'm evil＂ idea works for you.
Ha ha, I expect it does. I feel close to an answer now—I know it is within reach.
The day of the rite draws close, and I will have it mastered, whatever it takes!
The day before the Lambentree rite...
How is Zena? Will she be ready?
She's nearly there. ...Nearly.
Zena, will you be ready by tomorrow?
*huff* *pant* I'm...so close.... But...there's no time...
Maybe it's best to call the rite off.
No! If it isn't performed, calamity will befall the world!
Watching a friend tear herself apart over this feels pretty calamitous to me...
We all know how hard you tried, Zena. No one's gonna blame you if this thing can't be pulled off. I mean, stuff happens, ya know? We're still good.
And don't think for a moment that it threatens your place here among us.
(It's true that I pushed myself in order to justify my worth here at first.)
(But now...)
(This isn't for my own sake anymore; it is for this world, and I want to do all I can.)
(I want to protect this world!)
(As the Auspex, I seek to protect this world through the power of prayer.)
(This is Notte's world. Euden's world.)
Ah...
(This is the same feeling as back then; I feel I've remembered something vital to an Auspex I'd long since forgotten...)
(The Auspex is a pure being, and her mana won't respond to a tainted heart.)
(But now that I've reclaimed this pure desire, perhaps...)
Zena?
Please give me one final chance.
Well, I certainly won't stop you, but...
Then let me begin. ...HAAAAAAAH!
More... Still more! Use your mana to quell the power of the Other!
There! Now, just like that... release the mana's flow!
Holy freakin' casserole, she did it... ZENAAAA! YOU DID IIIIIT!
I'm ready to attempt the rite! I can do this. For the world, for all of you, and for Zethia!
This time, I will see my duties through!
The day of the Lambentree rite...
The emissaries from the Church are here, Zena. Are you ready?
I am indeed.
We have come to escort you, Auspex.
Then let us go to the Lambentree.
I shall defend the Auspex as a Paladyn. Fellow knights, fall in!
Maaaan, I hope Zena's gonna be okay...
I doubt any will realize she isn't Zethia.
The rite will succeed, and she'll return home to us. We have to believe that.
Phew...
You seem tired, Auspex, and the holy grove is some distance away yet. Will you be all right?
I am fine. Pray let us continue.
(The heart of the holy grove is a sacred place forbidden to all but the Auspex—and at its center grows a single great tree.)
(The Lambentree, grown since ancient times under the watchful stewardship of the Church.)
(When imbued with the Auspex's mana, the tree summons a breeze that carries said mana out across the heavens.)
(It then becomes a gentle rain of mercy which falls upon the land, blessing it.)
(On the day of the rite, the people watch the sky with faith in their hearts and hope for the age of peace that rain will bring...)
We have arrived. As the sacred domain lies beyond, I must ask that you now make for the Lambentree alone.
Is all well with you, Auspex?
Yes, all is well. I will return after seeing my duties completed.
Once all is done, we'll return together to the place where we belong.
Indeed. Now I must be on my way.
(As I draw closer to the tree, the mana grows thicker as if guiding me...)
This is it.
(The tree glows faintly. It is a surreal sight, no matter how many times I witness it.)
I must see this through. If I fail again...
(No. I will not fail.)
(I will protect this world. Not as Zethia, but as Zena.)
O Lambentree, hear my prayer...
My name is Zena, the Auspex chosen by holy mana.
Lend me now the couriers of the wind. Call forth clouds to grant rain unto the parched earth, and grant peace to all.
(...The Other's power is contained! It's working!)
...What? No! Why?!
The tree withers! Ah, but this is just like before!
And now it begins to spew miasma!
The mana flow grows unstable... I cannot begin to say what might happen now!
Aaaaaaah!
Meanwhile, at the Halidom...
Earthquake! Everybody down!
Phew! Looks like things have quit rockin' and rollin' for now. But does this mean...?
Yes, I'm afraid something may have happened to Zena.
The mana grows unstable. Was the rite a failure?
Bad news, folks! We got us a whole pack of incomin' fiends!
Is that because the mana's gone out of whack?!
Given this sudden a change, it's no surprise to see fiends stirred into a frenzy! What shall we do?!
We intercept them. I need response teams defending the nearby villages now!
Zena...
I know, Notte. We just have to hold faith that she succeeds and comes back to us.
Then I'm gonna put all the good vibes I got out into the world! Hang in there, Zena!
(The Lambentree has withered, the grove is choked with miasma, and the mana is in utter tumult...)
I am a failure. I have doomed us all.
(I'll lose this place as I have lost every world before it. How can I possibly live with myself after such a thing...?)
(Can I give up on this world?)
Well, lemme make it super clear: We love the SNOT out of you!
You're the only one who can save this world, Zena.
Once all is done, we'll return together to the place where we belong.
...No. Not even if it kills me.
This world forgave me, trusted in me, and gave me a home—so I won't give up no matter what comes!
(They said they even loved the part of me touched by the Other, so let that serve them well now!)
Let the Other's power do good for once, instead of ill!
(...No. This isn't about making use of the Other's power—I must make it my own.)
I will transform this twisted force into one of purity and good!
(I will not hold it back—instead, I will take the dregs of the Other's power and dye them with my own mana!)
(With an infusion of mana this great, I can pull the Lambentree back from the brink!)
(Please, I beg you! Hear my prayer!)
All eyes turned to the sky that day.
No wind blew. No rains fell. But just as all hope faded from the hearts of humans, a single blazing star cut a brilliant streak across the sky.
It was a fascinating, indescribable color, somehow black and white yet also neither.
But all who saw it spoke of it the same: ＂It was a gentle, loving color.＂
Holy mana then rained down upon the land, and the people rejoiced in the knowledge they would live in a blessed age, assured of prosperity.
The fiends are acting strangely... There! An opening!
Strike as one! Now!
Zena...
(We all know you've got this.)
(And you're our best bud, so you better come back to us in one piece!)
Haaaaah!
Ngh...
(Good. The Lambentree is restored. But my mana is completely drained...)
(I've not even the strength to return to my physical form in my own world.)
(My journey ends here... Forgive me, Euden...)
What?! Th-this is...
This mana flowing from the Lambentree...
I feel the prayers of everyone! Did the tree accept them and return them to me as mana?
(Then the Lambentree doesn't just pass the Auspex's mana on to the earth—it also transforms prayers into NEW mana!)
(That explains why the mana is so dense here!)
With the mana I received from everyone, I can continue!
I can keep the chain of prayer unbroken!
An earthquake, miasma, and now a shooting star? I've read nothing like this in all the histories.
I fear the rite has failed...
Mind your words, Father; the Auspex will succeed and return safely to us.
My faith in her remains unshaken.
(Please be safe, Zena!)
The miasma is clearing... And that's not all!
This mana... It's not merely pure, it's also astoundingly powerful!
What in the Goddess's name...?
There! The Auspex has returned!
The rite is complete. Until this same day nine-and-ninety years hence, my mana will keep this world safe.
Blessings and praise be upon her!
(I'M the blessed one; I've found something to protect and learned that I have the power to do so.)
(I will live here, in this world, until the day I'm able to fulfill my promise to you, Euden.)
And so, normal life continued from that day on.
But to me, everything felt brand new; a sure sign that I, myself, had changed.
(Until recently, I even felt guilt in prayer.)
(I was certain a tainted creature like me was unfit to offer up her prayers.)
(But knowing there are those in this world who will accept me and permit my presence here makes me able to offer prayers once more.)
(I do so for the people I love as well as all who reside in this world. And—)
C'mon, Zena! Let's go home!
Coming!
You really get into the zone when you make with the prayin' these days, huh?
Y-yes, I suppose so! Perhaps it's because I'm not simply praying for myself anymore.
And also, because I must see these prayers to a destination beyond this world.
I'm sure they will find their way back to your world.
And I hold that belief in my heart as I press on in this kind and lovely world...
